overview:
Kenny Dinkin is chief creative officer at PlayFirst where he oversees game design, art/animation and leads development of creative concepts, storyline and character for all PlayFirst games and serves as the creative cornerstone for the company. Kenny is an industry-recognized creative force with more than a decade of success on a wide array of consumer products and interactive platforms. Kenny was previously the worldwide head of product design for The Learning Company/Broderbund. In this role, he was the creative lead for the portfolio of premiere children’s software brands including Reader Rabbit, Carmen Sandiego and KidPix as well as licensed properties such as Scooby-Doo, Strawberry Shortcake, Batman, Powerpuff Girls and Arthur.

A visual artist, writer, musician, game designer and avid comic book reader, Kenny was also the co-creator of the critically acclaimed, top-selling brand The ClueFinders.

Kenny holds a Bachelor of Arts in History from Brown University and a Master of Fine Arts from University of Pennsylvania, School of Design.
